title: Sending a file from the W11 context menu
creator: noraves99
content: TB in WIN11. Right click on any file. In Win10, there was a "send to" option. In Win11, there's a "share" option. To send a file directly, select "show more options." The older version's menu will appear, and it will say "send to -> email recipient." Is there a way to generate an option to send files faster? When the file sending window appears from the file manager, the cursor in the message writing window doesn't move to the address field (as it does when composing a new message) but somewhere else. This is quite strange, because you automatically start typing the recipient's address, but it doesn't appear in the program. This is probably more a system issue than Mozilla's. Perhaps a registry entry or other action might work. Perhaps the submenu after right-clicking on a file, or the icon at the top next to "Copy, Paste, Cut" or in section share it.
metadata: ;solver_id:7019652;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:142.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/142.0

title: comportamiento del "doble click"
creator: franques2013
content:
Buenas tardes: Tengo el thunderbird completamente actualizado, pero desde hace unas semanas, en una de las cuentas de correo, cuando pulso el "intro" o el "Doble click", para abrir un mensaje en la bandeja de entrada, en vez de abrir el mensaje, me lo pone como para "responder". Sólo me pasa en una de las cuentas, en la otra, funciona todo ok.

Por favor, necesitaría una ayuda para resolver esta incomodidad. Sin embargo, si pulso la combinación de teclas "Ctrl+o" se abre correctamente, y si pulso el botón derecho del ratón y voy a la opción "Abrir", también lo hace correcto.

Quedo a la espera de sus amables noticias. Saludos cordiales. Carles F.

title: Base64 inline images not displayed in Thunderbird (shown as empty space)
creator: rom.btc.by
content:
When I compose a message in Thunderbird that contains an inline base64-encoded image (for example, an HTML ), the image is correctly visible in the compose window.

However, after sending the message:

Other mail clients and devices display the inline base64 image correctly.

In Thunderbird (both in Sent and Inbox folders), instead of the image there is just an empty placeholder/blank space.

Steps to reproduce:

Compose a new HTML message in Thunderbird.

Insert an inline base64 image (e.g., copy-paste from clipboard or manually via ).

Send the message.

Open the sent message in Thunderbird or receive it on the same Thunderbird client.

Actual result: The inline image is not displayed — only empty space is shown.

Expected result: Thunderbird should correctly render base64-encoded inline images, as other clients do.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/140.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: How to correct duplicate "Outbox" vs "Unsent messages"
creator: mozilla750
content: Having updated to 140.2.1 there are two Outboxes in my local data. They are both named Outbox but one refers to a location of "Outbox" and the other to a location of "Unsent messages". The former is the location where messages to be sent should go, the latter is the location used in previous versions of Thunderbird. Unfortunately Thunderbird is putting messages in the latter. Not only does this mean that my Thunderbird does not match the documentation but also the Send Later addon uses the former and is therefore not working. This seems to be an error in the update process. How can I get Thunderbird to use the correct location ("Outbox")? I can find nothing in prefs.js that relates to the location of the Outbox ... surely it can't be hard coded!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:142.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/142.0

title: How to disable the donation webpage/screen
creator: niko.o.generic
content:
How do I disable the donation webpage that opens (in Thunderbird) automatically?

A common suggestion is to disable the start page: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1226585 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1520014 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1515838 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1507571 That option is already unchecked.

Some seem to be suggesting that this page opens when an update happens: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1512477 There was no update installed lately.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:136.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/136.0

title: Transferring an name and email address from an excel file to an addess book in Thunderbird
creator: allanrosenwald
content: I have an excel spread sheet with names and related email addresses. I would like to import the names and related email addresses into an address book in Thunderbird. I have set up a new address book to receive the import. I have saved the Excel file in CSV format. However when I import the data from my Excel spreadsheet the only data that transfer is the email address and not the associated name. How do I successfully import both the name and the associated email address?

title: Don't get comments from one particular news site
creator: MKS1
content:
I'm not sure how to word this correctly, but I'll try. I write into a news site, in their comment section on a regular basis. And for years I've gotten responses from other readers on a very regular basis. In other words.....I read and article, and then I respond in the comment section, (in this case it's Newsmax) and more times than not I get a response from another reader. This has been going on for years. Now all of a sudden I don't get those responses. And I would notice, because more times than not i get angry responses from readers who vehemently disagree with me! I wrote to Newsmax to tell then of this problem....they checked, and found what I needed to do to correct it. I did. It must have been some glitch along the way, to change the way things were.

Anyway....I made the changes necessary, and that mostly had to do with making sure their "no-reply@newsmax.com was added to all of my address books, and wouldn't make their way to my "junk' folder etc. When in fact, while checking my address book and junk folder etc, those missing responses never made their way to those folders. They were nowhere to be found at all. So their other direction was to get in touch with TB and find out from this end what might be wrong! So that's what I'm doing. I miss bantering back and forth with other readers and commenters, but no matter what I do I can't get a response! Any help figuring this out would be more that greatly appreciated!

Thank you,

Michael
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:142.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/142.0

title: suddently cannot send emails, but can receive them.
creator: tsharding
content:
All of the sudden, I cannot send an email. I contact my ISP/email provider and my settings are good. I have tried everything I can find doing verious searches to try find a fix. Nothing has worked. I get a message that says "An error occurrd while sending mail. The mail server responded: [VO-1] Message blocked due to span content in the message. Please check the message and try again."

The text i was sending was completely blank - no attachments - with "test" in in the subject line, or without anything int he subject line. Additionally, I get the same error if there is a body to the email.

HELP!

title: Want NO Thunderbird Junk Filtering and ALL Emails Going to Inbox
creator: rdsurber
content:
I want to COMPLETELY turn off junk filtering in Thunderbird. I want ALL emails to appear in my Inbox. I want NO junk filtering. TB has started marking many emails as Junk in 1 of my 2 email accounts & automatically moving them to the Junk folder. These emails often are important and should never be classified as Junk. This is a serious problem.

Under Selection in Junk Filtering, I have NOT marked/checked "enable adaptive junk mail controls for this account." Also under Selection in Junk Filtering, I have NOT marked/checked "Trust junk mail set by." Under Destination and Retention, I have NOT marked/checked "Move new junk message to:". HOWEVER, there is a section under this category, i.e., Destination and Retention, for move to "junk folder on rdsurber@charter.net" that is currently marked/checked that I cannot access in order to unmark/uncheck it.

What can I do to ensure that absolutely NO emails are automatically marked as junk & NO emails are moved to the Junk folder? I would greatly appreciate help with this issue. Thank you!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/140.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/140.0.0.0

title: Outgoing email fails due to SMTP port timing out
creator: dareys
content:
Greetings,

I am currently having inconsistent results sending mail.

I can send an email from my IMAP Webmail interface but sending the same email from my THUNDERBIRD POP Desktop fails.

The error indicates that the SMTP outgoing connection from the host has timed out...

I have tried to check the mail host ports and they are all open ... e.g.

Test-NetConnection tulip.bradmark.com -Port 465 Test-NetConnection tulip.bradmark.com -Port 587 Test-NetConnection tulip.bradmark.com -Port 25

Is there a THUNDERBIRD configuration that might be affecting this?

I do realize that when you send an email there might be several hops and failure points and I can't help that, it is the nature of the internet.

Howerver, this looks more like my local configuration/network?

Thank you.

Jean-Pierre

PS I have temporarily disabled my firewall and VPN for testing, it has made no difference.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/139.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Linking Thunderbird to Yahoo Mail
creator: twojugs
content: I am having a problem with my Yahoo Mail. I am using Mozilla Thunderbird 11.5.18.0 on Windows7 and have successfully set-up the account and obtained permission from Yahoo to share data to my primary account. However, when I try to add a second e-mail to the account and obtain Yahoo permission, Yahoo does not change to the new e-mail account but retains the first account. This happens even if I am logged into the second account in Yahoo. If I continue, data from the first account is added to the second account, duplicating it. How can I get transfer permissions for another e-mail account in Yahoo?
